title: Model Editor: Plausible inertia for simple shapes

content.raw:
Currently all simple shapes have an identity inertia matrix. The matrix could be automatically calculated for the user, I can think of two ways:

# A - auto-calculate when scaling

1. The moment a unit-sized simple shape is inserted, it has a 1 Kg mass and corresponding inertia matrix. Use [AddBoxLink](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/ea496138695ed060a06e9a0c3fb6b658f08b16fd/gazebo/msgs/msgs.cc?at=default#cl-1819) for example.

1. If a link consisting of only a simple shape for visual/collision is scaled via the scaling handles or on the inspector, scale inertia matrix accordingly. Maybe there could be a checkbox next to the inertia matrix for the user to turn off this functionality in case they want to input different values.

1. Also update inertia matrix when the user manually edits the mass.

# B - calculate button

Alternatively to **A** 2 & 3, have a button next to the inertial info to `Calculate Inertia Matrix` which when pressed calculates the matrix according to the current scale. This way, there's no worry about conflicts between the auto-calculated values and user-input values. This button would only be available for links consisting of a single simple shape. The downside is that it forces the user to go and press the button.
